Description: Fragment of a pennanular ear- or hair-ring: a section, slightly more than half, of a ring formed of a marvered opaque white glass-rod, wrapped around an opaque black glass core, fused together. Glossy surface. The ring seems to have been built on a wire armature now lost as the central, lengthwise opening indicates. The black gaps between the white strips vary considerably in width.
Curator's comments: This type of earring was probably more widely used than the few surviving examples would suggest. A larger duplicate was included in Tutankhamun's funerary equipment (JE 61693-4 of the Cairo Collection, apparently unpublished). Still another example, unpublished, is in Brooklyn. It was purchased by Petrie in Cairo in 1905.
